alert.note: Alert for Bastrop (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 5:34PM CST until January 23 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Caldwell, Fayette, Gonzales and Lee. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Luling, Giddings, Smithville, Waelder, Dime Box, Rosanky, Cistern, Lake Somerville State Park & Trailway, Palmeto State Park, Upton, Carmine, Kirtley, Togo, West Point, Buescher State Park, Kovar, Winchester, Alum Creek, Plum and Bastrop State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
